title: [Epidemiology] New Zealand’s nationwide ‘lockdown’ to curb the spread of COVID-19 was highly effective. The effective reproductive number of its largest cluster decreased from 7 to 0.2 within the first week of lockdown. Only 19% of virus introductions resulted in more than one additional case.

[Epidemiology] A new study examines the effectiveness of COVID-19 control policies in 40 areas including countries and U.S. states. They found that policies with a lesser social impact including cancellation of public events and restrictions on gatherings was not enough; stay-at-home orders are also required.
